doc.field: Records of the Institute of African American Affairs
Records of the Institute of African American Affairs

This subseries contains audio and video recordings of programs, panels, readings, lectures, and music performances related to the Institute of African American Affairs (IAAA) dating from 1970 to 2007. This subseries includes speakers for the Black Genius Series including Angela Davis, Anna Deavere Smith, Joycelyn Elders, Stanley Crouch, and Walter Mosley. Other events include panel discussions and events for the Yari Yari: Black Women Writers and the Future Conferences; and recorded sessions from the 1982 Black Male Conferences; Birth of Black Cinema Symposium; and Slave Routes: The Long Memory Symposium. This subseries also contains footage from a circa 2000 Africa trip with Manthia Diawara and Danny Glover for the documentary, Diaspora Conversations from Goree to Dogon. See Series I and V for paper and electronic files containing event planning and publicity material.
